recipe_name: Baked apple with raisins and custard
author: Tony Tobin
method: Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. Place the butter, raisins, brown sugar and honey into a bowl and mix together. Place the apple onto a baking sheet and stuff with the butter mixture. Cook in the oven for eight minutes. For the custard, warm the milk and cream in a saucepan over a medium heat. Place the sugar, vanilla and eggs into a bowl and thoroughly mix together. While stirring, gradually add the creama and milk the over a low heat. Stir constantly, until the custard slightly thickens. To serve, place the apple on a serving plate and pour the hot custard around.
ingredients: 1 tbsp soft brown sugar,  30g/1oz butter,  20g/¾oz raisins,  honey, to drizzle,  ½ apple, cored,  150ml/6fl oz milk,  150ml/6fl oz double cream,  40g/1½oz caster sugar,  1 tsp vanilla essence,  2 free-range egg yolks
